title: Instant Pot Steel-Cut Oats Recipe
description: Make steel-cut oats in an Instant Pot with this delicious recipe that has the perfect oat-to-water ratio for a chewy, nutty, nutritious breakfast.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Cereals Oatmeal Recipes Instant Pot Steel-Cut Oats 4.9 (24) 23 Reviews 4 Photos Steel-cut oats and the Instant Pot: two of my favorite discoveries from the last 10 years. Top with ground flax seed, hemp seed, cinnamon, fruit, honey, syrup, vanilla extract, nut butter, etc. Submitted by MoMosGoGo Updated on November 28, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 3 cups water 1 cup steel-cut oats Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine water and oats in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 3 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Oats will thicken as they cool. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tip You can use soy milk or any nut milk in place of water. I Made It Print 36 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 300 Calories 5g Fat 54g Carbs 10g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 300 % Daily Value * Total Fat 5g 6% Saturated Fat 1g 5% Sodium 11mg 0% Total Carbohydrate 54g 20% Dietary Fiber 8g 29% Total Sugars 2g Protein 10g 20% Calcium 11mg 1% Iron 4mg 20% Potassium 4mg 0% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Steel-Cut Oats 01 of 04 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 04 Photo by  Tammy Lynn 09/29/2018 For me, this is the perfect method for IP steel-cut oats. This is so much easier than stove top, I now make them much more often than I used to. The liquid to oats ratio is the right consistency for me. And the time of 3 minutes is perfect. Other recipes call for 5 min or even up to 15 min! The oats start sticking to the pot after 5 minutes. They might seem a bit watery at first, but they thicken quickly. And you can put your add-ins right in the pot if you'd like. If your IP isn't done releasing pressure after 10 minutes, you can go ahead and release it. 03 of 04 Photo by  sanzoe 09/26/2018 This was cooked perfectly! Trying to eat healthier just got a lot easier. The oatmeal was tender but not mushy. 04 of 04 Photo by  Paula 04/05/2018 The ratio of liquid to steel-cut oats is perfect. So, I consider this a basic starting point recipe especially since salt and sweetener are omitted. I used 1 cup almond milk and 2 cups water (as the submitter suggested in the cook's notes). I also added chopped apples and cinnamon to top the oatmeal. 1 You’ll Also Love Easy Instant Pot® Creamy Pumpkin Spice Steel-Cut Oats 2 Ratings Instant Pot® Vegan Steel-Cut Oats with Apple and Cinnamon Instant Pot® Apple-Rosemary Steel-Cut Oats 3 Ratings Instant Pot® Cranberry-Pumpkin Steel Cut Oatmeal 5 Ratings Vegan Overnight Oats with Chia Seeds and Fruit 6 Ratings Instant Pot Apple Pie Steel-Cut Oats 26 Ratings Spiced Chai Overnight Oats 5 Ratings Overnight Slow Cooker Oatmeal 51 Ratings Maple and Brown Sugar Oatmeal 37 Ratings Super Duper Oatmeal 42 Ratings Overnight Steel-Cut Oatmeal 2 Ratings Steel-Cut Oats and Quinoa Breakfast 17 Ratings Peanut Butter and Maple Oatmeal 26 Ratings Slow Cooker Pumpkin Oatmeal 3 Ratings Blueberry Oatmeal 23 Ratings Peachy Oatmeal 26 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
